et psallem in glória mea. ^ My heart is: psaltérium et cìttara~; exsùrgem dilúculo. ^ Arise
my heart is ready~; I will sing: psaltery and harp~; I will arise in the morning early.

O God: ^ I will praise thee among the people
and I will sing unto thee among the nations

2 ^ Parátum cor meum Deus: 5 ^ qŭia magna est super caĕlos misericórdia tua
parátum cor meum~; cantábo: et usqŭe ad nubes vèritas tua. ^ for thy mercy is great above the heavens
et psallem in glória mea. ^ My heart is: and thy truth even unto the clouds.
et super omnem terram glória tua
O God: ^ Be thou exalted above the heavens
and thy glory over all the earth

2 ^ Parátum cor meum Deus: 7 ^ ut liberèntur dilècti tui~; salvum fac dèxtera tua
parátum cor meum~; cantábo: et exáŭdi me. ^ that thy beloved may be delivered~; save with thy right hand and hear me.

2 ^ Parátum cor meum Deus: 8 ^ Deus locútus est in sancto suo
O God: et convállem tabernaculórum dimétier. ^ God hath spoken in his holiness
and I will divide Sichem and I will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

et psallem in glória mea. ^ My heart is: et Èfraim suscèptio cápitis mei~; Juda rex meus. ^ Giliad is mine
my heart is ready~; I will sing: and Ephraim the protection of my head~; Judah is my king.

2 ^ Parátum cor meum Deus: 10 ^ Moab lebes spei meaĕ~; in Iduméam extèndem calceamèntum meum~; mìhi alienígenaĕ amici facti sunt.~»^ Moab is the pot of my hope~; over Idumea I will stretch out my shoe~; the aliens are become my friends."
11 ^ ¿~Qŭìs dedúcet me in civitátem munítam~? ¿~Qŭìs dedúcet me usqŭe in Iduméam~? ^ Who will bring me into the strong city~? Who will lead me into Idumea~?

my heart is ready~; I will sing: in virtútibus nostrîs~? ^ Wilt not thou
column7: who hast cast us off~? And wilt not thou

parátum cor meum~; cantábo: qŭia vana salûs hòminis. ^ O grant us help from trouble
et psallem in glória mea. ^ My heart is: for vain is the help of man.

parátum cor meum~; cantábo: et ipse ad nìhilum dedúcet inimícos nostros. ^ Through God we shall do mightily
et psallem in glória mea. ^ My heart is: and he will bring our enemies to nothing.
